description: The focus of this course is on the valuation of companies. Topics discussed include discounted cash flow techniques and valuation using alternative valuation techniques such as price multiples. Emphasis is on developing the required information for valuation from financial statements and other information sources.
name: CORPORATE VALUATION

values.comments:
The focus of FNCE207 is on the valuation of companies. Topics discussed include discounted cash flow techniques and valuation using alternative valuation techniques such as price multiples. Emphasis is on developing the required information for valuation from financial statements and other information sources. The prerequisites are FNCE100, FNCE101, STAT101 and STAT102. ACCT201 is also recommended.

Students recommended this course as “something all finance majors should take” but warn that it is taught in a manner similar to graduate courses in that “the professor never ever gives a straight answer.” Other students stressed the “ambiguity” of the class but summarized by calling it “very rewarding.”

Students described Professor Glode as “highly entertaining” and also said that he “knew his material very well.” He worked hard to “make a dry subject interesting.” They warn that he likes to read off of his slides a bit too frequently. 

Students warned that the course had a bulk pack of 1100 pages, and described it as “very dense and disorganized.” The final project has a “very specific set of requirements” and the course could use more sample problems. Many students felt the open-book exams were fair and “straightforward.” Also, many lauded his transparency, explaining that the “process of valuation is broken down pretty well, giving students a deep understanding of each step.” They felt comfortable with the Professor’s expectations.
